physical_examinations.vital_signs: Height: 5′8″, Weight: 245 lb at maximum weight, Weight: 101 lb at admission in January 2000, Weight: 130 lb at discharge, Weight: 107.6 lb at April 2002 admission, Weight: 135 lb at discharge
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient experienced fainting and bleeding due to a gastric ulcer at age 16. CT scan showed three visible tumors in August 2001. Transient edema in lower extremities in January 2002 due to severe weight loss and food restriction.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: His weight decreased significantly from 245 lb to 101 lb over a year and a half, followed by fluctuations as he continued to struggle with food intake and weight management, indicating a cycle of severe restriction and temporary gains.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Abusing laxatives, running 3 to 4 miles, doing 2,000 sit-ups each day.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially lost 100 lb over 7-8 months but was hospitalized for severe weight loss and food restriction.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Met diagnostic criteria for anorexia nervosa, binge/purge type. Severe restriction of food intake; only two meals a day.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive decrease of 22.4 lb from his previous discharge weight, indicating worsening of the eating disorder.
